items.title: Peter Pan
items.author: J.M.Barrie
items.description: Follow the story of the boy who doesn't grow up...

items.title: Little Women
items.author: Louisa May Alcott
items.description: Meet Jo, Beth, May and Amy, four girls of nineteenth century New England.

items.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
items.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
items.description: In this tale of good and evil, Mr Jekyll develops a potion which unleashes his secret persona, Mr Hyde.

items.title: Nicholas Nickleby
items.author: Charles Dickens
items.description: When Nicholas Nickleby is left alone after his father's death, he seeks out his rich uncle for help.

items.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
items.author: Victor Hugo
items.description: The story of a hunchbacked bellringer, Quasimodo, as he falls in love with beautful gypsy, Esmerelda.

items.title: Moby-Dick
items.author: Herman Melville
items.description: Fight against reality and fantasy in this war on the whales.

items.title: The Complete Grimm's Fairy Tales
items.author: Jacob & Wilhelm Grimm
items.description: An anthology of stories full of magic and mythology.

items.title: Frankenstein
items.author: Mary Shelley
items.description: A Gothic thriller and a dark romance, between monster and man.

items.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
items.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
items.description: The misty moors surrounding the Baskerville family's home hold a deep, dark secret.

items.title: Jane Eyre
items.author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
items.description: The life story of Jane Eyre, orphaned as a child, as she falls in love with one, Mr Rochester.
